name: Donate to Megan Summer
description: A old and dear friend of mine is going through a tough time with her daughter who suffers from a rare form of Kidney Disease. I’m doing whatever I can to help assist with the costs of surgery and treatment and I’m asking my friends and fans to give whatever they can to help this little lady beat this disease and go one living a healthy and productive life.

name: Block Pro Tee (Grey)
description: I was hanging out with my friend and talented clothing designer, Ryan Gagliardi in Philly one day and I showed him a prototype for a promo t-shirt I was interested in printing.  He looked at the shirt, a basic white tee with the lyrics to my song "Trauma da Block Pro" written on it, and handed me a napkin and said "write the lyrics down right now on this!"  I started to write the lyrics and he looked at the napkin and said "this is your t-shirt!" The Block Pro Tee is an authentic scan of my handwritten lyrics on a bar napkin.  Cool story right? It's actually true!

name: For Colored Girls (& White Chicks Too)
description:
Following Ntozake Shange’s play and the Tyler Perry film adaptation, 623 Entertainment and Traum Diggs release the mixtape, For Colored Girls (& White Chicks Too).  On the 15- track project, Traum Diggs tackles various scenarios of love, lust and devotion as seen through the eyes of 4 women and the men they’re involved with.  Through original tracks and a few covers, Diggs rediscovers the lost art of the “concept album” and creates what many are calling his best work to date.  

For Colored Girls (& White Chicks Too) is centered on the characters, Kelly, Shonte, Natalie and Ms. Rose.  Each has a unique testimony which is then addressed by a series of songs that follow; almost as if the album were a play with 4 separate acts.   For each “testimony” Diggs borrows from Nina Simone’s classic song, “Four Women” and raps from the perspective (and voice) of each individual lady.
